name: places/ChIJ8xDAkBlawokRExtJn7OLMEE
formattedAddress: 185 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10006, USA
adrFormatAddress: 185 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10006, USA

originalText.text: I work nearby and the chocolate is really good but why is this location closed for long periods of time in the middle of the day? It tends to open later than the posted 10am every day and the employees seem to always be on break for long periods of time whenever I try to go there.

text.text: I work nearby and the chocolate is really good but why is this location closed for long periods of time in the middle of the day? It tends to open later than the posted 10am every day and the employees seem to always be on break for long periods of time whenever I try to go there.

originalText.text: There chocolate is really good. Great chocolate leaves a nice fresh after taste feel in your mouth. I sampled maybe 9 different pieces of Dark chocolates with almond, hazelnuts. And a few other variants.

text.text: There chocolate is really good. Great chocolate leaves a nice fresh after taste feel in your mouth. I sampled maybe 9 different pieces of Dark chocolates with almond, hazelnuts. And a few other variants.

originalText.text:
I’m so disappointed in how the quality of service in this store has declined! The associates used to be friendly, warm and helpful. Today, I went in to redeem my birthday reward (I’m part of their membership program), and the woman behind the counter gave me trouble every step of the way. She refused to look at or scan my email from Neuhaus, detailing my birthday reward, and then told me she couldn’t find me in their system. Again, all she had to do was look at the email I repeated offered to show her on my phone.
After she finally found me in their system, she told me my birthday wasn’t in the system so it wasn’t possible for me to have an award, still refusing to look at the email. Then her story changed and now my reward was expired. For the last time I held up my phone and showed her that the reward was still valid. She rolled her eyes, scoffed, and said, “fine, just take one of those boxes over there,” and turned away from me. (For the record, the email states that the reward is for a box of chocolates of my choice, but given how deplorable her service was and how rude she was being, I just took the box she pointed at and left.)

originalText.text:
This review is only about the quality of the chocolate , the store location is fine, the service is great and friendly, the selection is okay BUT having tried Neuhaus chocolates in Belgium , these chocolates are either produced in America with local ingredients or they have lost freshness during shipping. But certainly the flavour is NOT THE SAME, even though prices are….
So, don’t get me wrong , chocolates are good and probably better than many other fine chocolatiers, but you don’t get the same unique experience and tradition that Neuhaus chocolates in their natal country.

But certainly the flavour is NOT THE SAME, even though prices are….
So, don’t get me wrong , chocolates are good and probably better than many other fine chocolatiers, but you don’t get the same unique experience and tradition that Neuhaus chocolates in their natal country.

originalText.text:
WOW!!! I knew this place had great chocolate but I cannot speak more highly of the service we received here. The young woman who was working, Alouise (?), was absolutely fantastic.  She had such a warm and positive energy but wasn’t fake or pushy. She was so meticulous and thorough - from the color of the box ribbon to the spacing of the chocolates in the box - and made us feel like we made a 100% customized product that was worth every penny and more. She offered us samples and showed us the little chocolate catalog in case she could find us a chocolate that we were interested in but was not on display.  I wish all service workers were as genuine and thoughtful as her. For once, I was actually sad that there wasn’t a pop-up option to tip her off of my credit card.

My boyfriend and I have worked multiple service industry jobs and we both agreed that this was the best in-store experience we’ve ever had anywhere. Homegirl deserves a raise or promotion and should seriously consider a career in sales. Super happy to bring back this gift to my grandma.
